text: Cardiff Central railway station is a main train station in Cardiff, the capital city of Wales. It is on the South Wales Main Line. It is the 11th busiest station in the United Kingdom, except for stations in London.Usage report Retrieved 4 July 2012 The station is managed by Transport for Wales. Arriva run services along with First Great Western and CrossCountry. The station has a first class area, the only one in Wales.First Great Western Retrieved 4 July 2012 It opened as Cardiff, then Cardiff General in July 1924 and Cardiff Central in May 1973 to now.Cardiff Timeline Retrieved 12 July 2012 ==References== Category:Buildings and structures in Cardiff Category:Railway stations in Wales
title: Cardiff Central railway station
